Summary: Star Like pulsating light go down below tree line towards Luton Airport
divs: Sighting DetailsI live in an area of stevenage where alot of activitity from Luton Airport is visible at most times of the day I was in my bedroom which allows me to see the final descent of aircraft as they approach the airport, now I noticed there was a particularly high volume of traffic held in stacks at the outer markers and it was this that brought me to the window in the first place my bedroom faces south and the flight path lies in a south westerly direction, on the night in question it was around 7pm the flights were on departure so the aircraft were flying towards me in a north easterly direction and this is where my uncertainty on the object being a plane comes in, as it was flying towards Luton Airport ( south westerly ) bearing right heading west it was visible for just over a minute, there were planes leaving the airport just prior and just after the event which tells me that there would possibly be radar signatures from planes in the vicinity and possibly the tower at Luton itself ( I have been told that their scanning range is 12 miles up with a 25 mile radius ) Now obviously living near an airport I am automatically going to think that it was a plane but having lived here all my life I will recognise a plane when I see one and the directions they take at certain points in their ascent and descent. The object in question did not conform to any of these rules and was not what I would call "of normal aircraft appearance" there was one solid light that pulsated but never vanished and it changed colour from BLUE to WHITE to YELLOW to ORANGE to RED, then the sequence of colours would start over in the same order never flashing but simply melding into the next The object had a fluent movement and did not fluctuate in height while visible, my view of it was not impeded in any way, there was a slight shimmering of the light but that was possibly caused by the chimneys present between me and it, after the minute and 20 seconds it disappeared behind a line of trees and I did not see it again I stayed at the window for more than ten minutes while I was on the phone trying to reach anyone in the know at Luton Airport the object did not return but I did see a couple more planes leaving Luton Airport, without the lights on the wings the headlights of these planes would be compareable in brightness to that of the object I saw I am of sound mind and judgement had not been drinking and do not do drugs and I know what I saw was out of the ordinary
trends: There have been 91 other sightings in London
There were no other sightings in London on or around March 7th 2010
